text: hi everyone Anthony Fantino here
the Internet's busiest music nerd and
it's time for you reviewed and Egon
America Dan Deacon is an electronic
music producer singer and composer this
is his latest LP the follow-up to which
was his his breakout album really Brahms
now a lot of you older needle drops not
an age but in viewership may remember
that I did not care for that album at
all when it came out and and these days
I still really don't like it I mean to
me Brahms days is really the act of
trying to show 30 pounds of into a
ziplock just so many tracks on this LP
are made up of skyscraper sized layers
of fuzz Dow glitchy just very harsh and
distorted abrasive electronics all
arpeggiating very brightly all at once
just not really an enjoyable listening
experience for me plus I didn't really
think the mixing was all too good on
that album either me personally I prefer
them much more raw and playful
spider-man of the Rings America is
loaded with really bright tones very
sharpen and rough textures the kind of
stuff that is just gonna get you
standing up at attention really quickly
many tracks on this thing are a sensory
overload but not really a fulfilling one
for me it's really kind of like throwing
crushed Oreos and sour patch kids and
Froot Loops into a cereal bowl and then
just pouring four loko on top and then
just digging in and you may be saying at
this point Anthony I I agree with you to
an extent on that description or maybe
all the way
but that's what makes Dan deacons music
awesome and that's when I feel like our
two opinions are gonna be at an impasse
and even though I don't really like Dan
deacons most recent stuff I do admire
him for being a musician with his own
sound a guy who consistently gives his
fans what they want and makes the
records that he wants to make but from
my perspective there are a lot of songs
that he makes these days that just do
not have a lot of balance you get a lot
of bright sounds a lot of loud sounds
and they are just unrelenting to the
point where it all just kind of ends up
feeling like static to me after a while
as I progress through a song even if the
beginning may kind of catch my ear or
sound pretty good to me however I will
say in comparison to Brahms America is
much more varied and features quite a
few tracks that I like there are some
tracks on the Selphy word and Deacon is
actually composing songs with
traditional orchestral instrumentation
and it makes a lot of his compositions
shine the students approach to composing
music is is relatively minimal a lot of
very simple repetitive progressions
melodies arpeggios it's basic but also
pretty beautiful when I run across a
track on here like pretty boy where you
actually do kind of get some some real
live instrumentation but mixed with
electronics that swirl and glisten don't
glitch out and distort and the way the
track just escalates it's really like
some epic progressive synth Vangelis
Chariots of Fire types it's synthetic
moving and epic where Dan loses me is is
on a track like crash Jam the
electronics on this thing are fuzzed out
as usual but to kind of add insult to
injury for me on this track he throws
all of the least interesting sounds into
the foreground and buries all of the
better sounds underneath than the vocals
the drums the chords the first half of
this LP was kind of hit or miss for me
the second half is is like a completely
different section of the album it is
basically a group of tracks creating a
suite that is titled after this album
and I'll be damned if the first movement
of this thing USA is a monster which
maybe a statement or maybe a reference
to the band of the same name either way
to me this is really one of the best
tracks I've ever heard dandy can make
there is an awesome orchestral intro on
the song that should stop anybody in
their tracks who's listening to this
thing all the way through the electronic
glitches and and distortions that Dan
usually works with eventually make their
way into the track but they don't
overstay their welcome and as the song
continues they kind of get blended with
that nice sounding orchestral
instrumentation I like that combo
overall the song does not feel as just
obnoxious or annoying or as overbearing
as some of his more electronic tracks
can like the next song on this week the
great American desert eventually the
song ended up kind of sounding exactly
like that just a desert a barren
wasteland of just static that I'm not
interested in hearing however the song
rail right after is just completely
orchestral instrumentation totally
barren of electronics and it is lovely
and it's just a great show of how Dan
Deacon understands interplay and in
counterpoint and when you can actually
hear it on the closing track you have
electronics mixed with a pretty epic
gargantuan chorus but the electronics
just kind of come to the forefront and
drown the chorus out I mean why the
electronics aren't even that interesting
especially this point in the album when
they are pretty much doling out the same
exact sounds and Tambor's that you've
been hearing for the entire album
overall I got to say I'm torn on this
album there was a handful of songs on
here that I felt like wow I mean some of
the best material I've ever heard Dan
Deacon put out I love it when he's just
working with normal orchestral
instrumentation and maybe it would even
sound great with him mixing it with the
electronics if he had just more of a
balance and not really one suffocating
the other but as you guys know that's
just my opinion
I'm feeling a strong 5 on this LP if you
guys give it a listen what did you think
about it love it hate it
why what should I review next and
remember the good comment the great rate
only the strong subscribe
dan deacon America forever
